meanings.definition: The characteristic quality of sound produced by a particular instrument or voice.
meanings.sent1: The timbres of the flute and the violin are very different.
meanings.sent2: I love the rich timbres of the cello in the orchestra.
meanings.sent3: The timbres of the trumpet and the tuba had a playful conversation in the jazz band.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had the timbres of a gentle breeze on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The timbres of the piano keys echoed through the concert hall.

meanings.definition: The color or quality of sound that distinguishes one voice or musical instrument from another.
meanings.sent1: The timbres of the saxophone and the clarinet blend beautifully in the jazz ensemble.
meanings.sent2: His singing voice has unique timbres that captivate the audience.
meanings.sent3: The timbres of the guitar and the drums had a friendly competition in the rock band.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had the timbres of a tinkling bell.
meanings.sent5: The timbres of the violin added a touch of magic to the symphony.
